definition: car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159
(classical) this, that/he, she, they/(exclamatory final particle)/(initial particle, introduces an opinion)

sentences.english: The coachman wrapped himself up in his cloak.
They entered the carriage once more, and the coachman mounted his box.
sentences.chinese: 他们又坐上马车，车夫坐到自己的位子上。

sentences.english: It was like owning your private carriage and having a coachman who wore a silk hat.
sentences.chinese: 就像你拥有了一辆私人马车，就连车夫都戴着大礼帽。

sentences.english: People think the two chauffeurs were murderers, and have them had the devil to pay.
sentences.chinese: 大家认为这两个车夫是杀人犯，要他俩付出代价。

sentences.english: He paid the carriage hire to the driver.
sentences.chinese: 他把马车租金给了马车夫。

sentences.english: A waggoner was once driving a heavy load on a very muddy road.
sentences.chinese: 一名车夫赶着货车沿着一条非常泥泞的小路前行。

sentences.english: Hollandis called "the marine horse-drawn vehicle husband", its trade partner proliferates the whole world.
sentences.chinese: 荷兰被称为“海上马车夫”，其贸易伙伴遍布全球。

sentences.english: Gerald helped his wife into the carriage and gave orders to the coachman to drive carefully.
sentences.chinese: 杰拉尔德把妻子扶进马车，叮嘱车夫小心驾驶。

sentences.english: When the wagon driver woke up, he found himself lying on a bed in the medical ward.
sentences.chinese: 运货马车夫醒来时发现他躺在医院病房的床上。

sentences.english: He was walking in that direction holding the old lady firmly and with care.
sentences.chinese: 这车夫扶着那老女人，便正是向那大门走去。

sentences.english: His voice was thick, but he asked the questions that cabbies always ask in the park.
sentences.chinese: 他的声音浓浊，但他还是问了几个马车夫常问的问题。

sentences.english: Each chariot has four bronze horses and a bronzed figure driver.
sentences.chinese: 每架战车都有四匹铜马和一个铜制车夫。

sentences.english: Alpatitch went back to the house, and calling the coachman told him to set off.
sentences.chinese: 阿尔帕特奇回到屋里，叫了车夫，吩咐他赶车上路。

sentences.english: Perhaps the rickshaw runner would know where the temple was.
sentences.chinese: 车夫大概会知道卡利女神庙在哪里。

sentences.english: The last words were spoken to Polly and the Cabby who had now arrived.
sentences.chinese: 最后一句是对刚刚到达的波莉和马车夫说的。

sentences.english: Hardly one cart or wagoner passes in a quarter of an hour.
sentences.chinese: 一刻钟里难得有一辆小车和一个车夫走过。

definition: person in charge of pack animals/chariot driver
forced labor of feudal tenant (corvée)/bailiff of feudal yamen
